definition: Cost per year with one-off costs distributed over the duration of the information collection.
Time, effort, or financial resources required to generate, maintain, or provide information for a collection.
A one-time expense to buy something needed to answer an information collection request.
Federal contractors are considered members of the public under the PRA.
Permission to collect a specific set of data from the American public.
Two four-digit numbers separated by a hyphen. The first four digits identify the sponsoring agency and bureau, and the last four identify the particular collection.
Changes that are purely cosmetic in nature.
The OIRA staff member reviewing an information collection request.
Status for collections that do not require OMB approval under specific statutory reasons, despite otherwise meeting the criteria.
The process for approval for a collection already covered by an existing generic clearance.
The daily journal of the United States government. Its use is required by the PRA to gather comments from the public during the 60- and 30-day comment periods. https://www.federalregister.gov/
A broad type of standard clearance issued in advance for a group of similar, low-burden collections. A good fit for surveys.
A proposal and process for requesting information. PRA approval is granted to collections.
OIRA's annual report sent to Congress summarizing the major activies under PRA, and the total burden of information collection
Details about a proposed collection to be reviewed by the agency, public, and OIRA desk officers.
A proposal and process for requesting information. PRA approval is granted to collections.
Details about a proposed collection to be reviewed by the agency, public, and OIRA desk officers.
A change made to an information collection that requires OIRA review and approval but does not require public comment.
Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, part of the Office of Management and Budget
Office of Management and Budget

For purposes regarding the Paperwork Reduction Act, a person can be an individual, individuals representing a partnership, association, corporation, legal representative—or any combination of these. Also includes state, territorial, tribal, or local governments.
The Paperwork Reduction Act. A law governing how federal agencies collect information from the American public.

Personally Identifiable Information. Information that can be used to distinguish or trace an individual’s identity, either alone or when combined with other information that is linked or linkable to a specific individual
People or groups outside of the federal government. Federal employees and military personnel are not considered the public under the PRA.
The practice and process of organizing and maintaining information, documents, or data as required by an agency's guidelines.
Regulatory Information Service Center (RISC) RISC/OIRA Combined Information System (ROCIS) is the digital platform used by agencies to submit PRA clearance requests to OIRA.
To cause or trigger the collection of information. Agencies sponsor collections.
